jobDescription: GENERAL SUMMARY: Under minimal supervision and working independently, using workforce management tools provides support and effective staff planning to deliver the appropriate level of service to Beaumont patients within a contact center environment. The scheduler/analyst must have a clear and working understanding of the inter-relationships between staffing, scheduling and the contact distributions of the work product. The scheduler/analyst must also have a clear and working understanding of the Beaumont Health Time Entry system, correlation with workforce management tools. In addition, to understanding the use of WFM, must also have very strong writing, computer skills and the ability to effectively communicate the resulting analysis to the management team. STANDARD QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.  A. Education / Training: Associates Degree or 2+ years data analysis in related field  B. Work Experience: WFM (workforce management ) experience, preferred  C. Certification, Licensure, Registration:  D. Other Qualifications: Strong computer skills and aptitudeNetwork environmentMicrosoft office applicationsKnowledge of WFM applicationsKnowledge of the business rule of Contact Centers and how it relates to the business of the corporation.
